1.text: Welcome to 'WattVillage', your playground for experiencing an energy community!

2.text:
In this game, you're playing as 'Rut'.

Rut lives in a small neighbourhood that is looking to invest in solar panels as a means to gain energy independence and save money.

The solar panel installed on Rut's apartment building will generate electricity during the daytime, that can either be used during daily activities or sold to the national energy grid.

3.text:
There are no batteries installed in the building, so using the solar energy can be tricky as Rut goes to work. Fortunately, she has invested in a couple of 'smart applicances' that can be scheduled to run anytime during the day.

Consuming energy during peak-hours (when demand is the highest) can be costly, so scheduling activitites to other times can save money. This is called 'load shifting'.

4.text: At the top of the screen, you'll see a number of statistics for your daily energy costs. In order to clear a level, you must schedule your activities in a way that saves enough money to meet the daily target.

5.text:
Right now, Rut lives alone in her apartment building and has one solar panel installed. As the game progresses, more people will join the community and the solar panels will increase (but more on that later!)

Click the 'Schedule' button you're ready to start scheduling.

Good Luck!

1.text:
Welcome to the activity scheduler!

Use the sliders to schedule different energy-consuming activities.

Feel like the schedule is too crowded? Use the buttons above the schedule to toggle different graphs.

2.text: Because of Rut's fancy gadgets, certain activities can be done remotely and at the same time, such as washing and charging the car. Rut also doesn't take the car to work, so feel free to schedule these activities anytime you wish.

3.text: Other activities, such as making dinner and watching TV, requires Rut to be present. As such, they cannot be done at the same time.

4.text:
At the bottom of the schedule you'll see a projection of today's savings, letting you know if you're on the right track.

When you're happy with the schedule, click the 'Start day' button to begin the day.

1.text:
It's now time to see Rut go about her daily activities!

The daily simulation will run for 24 in-game hours and aims to show you how different actions can impact the current energy balance in the apartment building.

2.text:
The power lines and appliances will help visualize current electricity consumption.

The clock in the top-right corner helps keep track of the time.

3.text: Other than that, sit back and watch the effort of your scheduling unfold!
